heading: no sound of music
subheading: julie andrews, who as a singing nun made the hills come alive with the sound of music, is suing a new york hospital and two doctors for allegedly ruining her famous singing voice. a medical malpractice suit filed in a manhattan federal court claims the defendants botched a 1997 surgery to remove a polyp from her vocal cords. the 64-year-old singing actress is seeking "substantial damages" for her loss of earnings.
author: wired staff
